summary.p:
A multi-text mansucript containing:
The Tiruttoṇṭattokai, that is, Tēvāram 7.39, by Cuntarar (U2a, f1-f2v1; 11 stanzas).
The Periya Purāṇam (U2b, f2v1-f286; 4281 stanzas).
The two texts follow one another directly on the same page (f2v): the Tiruttoṇṭattokai ends on f2v1 and the the Periya Purāṇam starts immediately after, on the same line.
This is possibly an Ariel manuscript, borrowed by Vinson and later returned by Vinson.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (March 2022).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Verso blank.

279 folios. Tamil foliation 1-286 with foliation gaps/missing folios. 274 folios in order of succession, with gaps, followed by 5 folios, with foliation lost, which must fill some of the gaps. More precisely: Tamil foliation 1-33, 35-38, 40-48, (49), 50-55, 58-60, [61], 62-68, [69], [70], 71-161, 72-223, [224], 225-230, 232-239, 241-263, 266-268, 270-275, 277-278, (279/280), 281.1, 281.2, 283, [284] (this folio is unblackened and found between blackened folios; hence, it is most probably misplaced), 285-286 + 5 folios (lf 275-279; lost foliation). Library black pencil Arabic foliation 1-279.
2 folios = Tiruttoṇṭattokai. Tamil foliation 1-2. From f1r1 to f2v1.
278 folios = Periya Purāṇam. Tamil foliation 2-286 with foliation gaps/missing folios. From f2v1 to f286v2.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively poor state of preservation: cracks, boreholes, several folios truncated.

binding.p: Original wood covers. 425 x 30 mm. With a wooden stick (to be threaded into one of the two holes), now broken in two pieces.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not after 1854, if indeed, it was part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Possibly owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). The title page is typical of Ariel's manuscripts, but the bundle lacks the BnF donation sticker, which is usually found in Ariel manuscripts. If so, bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177). Owned / Borrowed by Julien Vinson (1843-1926). See handwritten addition, f2v, no. 943 to Cabaton (1912).

acquisition.p: Acquired, June 20th, 1930, from Paul Vinson. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 3 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1894-1950, no. 13591.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See handwritten addition, f2v, no. 943.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
